title: My 50/50 partner in my LLC decided to transfer money into one of our other accounts and decided to try and stop the business.
question: I withdrew the money. we have since split the company assests. Vans, equipment, computers. Now he wants all of back and the monery after we agreed and I signed a resignation, wehat can I do?
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Business,LLC operating agreement
answers:
Do you have an Operating Agreement signed by your partner? Did your partner accept your resignation? Notwithstanding your resignation, you should read the OA and follow the instructions on what to do for dissolving the LLC. One of you is the designated manager for tax matters, and that person needs to file for the dissolution with the Secty of State, and wrap up final tax returns, etc., or your partner needs to accept that responsibilty.

Richard A. Rodgers, Esq. (805) 230-2525
rar@sd-attorneys.com
www.sdresq.com

As stated in the AVVO.COM Terms and Conditions of Use, this answer is not intended as legal advice, and no attorney-client relationship or privilege is created by this response.

Was there any written agreement in how you two will dissolve the LLC and split up the assets and the responsibilities for paying any debts or obligations of the LLC? Was there any agreement and/or consideration for you resigning from the company? Was there agreement when you "split the assets of the company" as in did he/she "accept" the assets of the LLC?

If you would like a FREE MEMORANDUM on dissolving the LLC, just send us an email.

By Grace...
Shawn Jackson ESQ. (707) 584-4529
Business Development Attorney EMAIL: Attorneys@CaliforniaBusinessDevelopment.com
www.CaliforniaBusinessDevelopmentAttorneys.com
www.CaliforniaBusinessDevelopmentCenter.com
No communication resulting herein shall create an attorney-client relationship unless a separate retainer agreement is signed by attorney and client. You should not act upon this information without seeking professional counsel such as any attorney in this office in a subsequent email communication (agreement) and the formation of an attorney client relationship.

If you and he have split, divided the assets equally, and you resigned from the LLC, there is nothing more for you to do.

If he wants your half back, tell him no. The next move is then his. He can accept it or he can sue.
